about_the_game:
About the Game

Naribiki Village is a first-person, single-player exploration horror game. The focus is on exploring the uncharted village of Naribiki, where uncovering clues will reveal the truth about what happened there.

Story

In 2000, a post on a certain bulletin board mentioned that a tunnel-like structure appeared on a cliff that had collapsed due to a large typhoon. After seeing this post, the protagonist, who lived nearby, decided to head to the location. Beyond the tunnel, they found a village that was not on any map. The protagonist begins to investigate why this village, Naribiki Village, exists.

Game Setting

The game was created with reference to abandoned buildings and villages in Japan.

Ruins Exploration Mode for Those Who Are Not Fond of Horror

Just like in the previous game, we have included a Ruins Exploration Mode with no horror elements at all, making it playable even for those who dislike horror games. This time, players can freely change the time of day, allowing them to explore the abandoned village in various scenarios. In Ruins Exploration Mode, players can use the camera feature to take photos of the ruins.

2-3 Hours of Gameplay

Guidelines for Videos, Livestreams, and Image Posting for the Game "Naribikimura"

These guidelines apply to both corporations and individuals.

1, Videos and livestreams that feature "Naribikimura" can be shared for both commercial and non-commercial purposes.

2, All scenes within the game are allowed to be posted.

3, Please include the store page URL in the description or summary:

4, Still images taken with the in-game camera or in Ruin Exploration Mode can be posted or edited for non-commercial use only.

Note: Using still images in monetized video thumbnails is allowed.

5, Selling still images taken with the in-game camera or in Ruin Exploration Mode is prohibited.

6, Posting on sites that violate public order and morals or posting content that misrepresents the game is prohibited.

7, Regarding members-only or closed livestreams:

They are allowed.

We would appreciate it if you could share your impressions of the game, but this is not mandatory.

8, When posting on social media, we would appreciate it if you could use the hashtag #鳴蟇村.

※Cautionary note

Please be aware that this product is not compatible with the Steam Deck.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 or greater
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Geforce GTX 1650 or greater
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX compatible sound card. Stereo headphones are recommended.
  • Additional Notes: Available in 16:9 aspect ratio only. 30FPS in 1920x1080 with the highest settings.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 or greater
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Geforce RTX 3060 or greater
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX compatible sound card. Stereo headphones are recommended. To enable spatial sound, you need to enable Windows Sonic, Dolby Atmos, or DTS Sound Unbound.
  • Additional Notes: Available in 16:9 aspect ratio only. 60FPS in 1920x1080 with the highest settings.

short_description: Guided by information from a bulletin board, the protagonist arrives at the uncharted village of Naribiki. With no way to turn back, he must explore the village to find a way out. As he delves deeper into the heart of Naribiki Village, the hidden mysteries of this eerie place slowly come to light...
